Reviews.Title: “OMG! THIS HOTEL SHOULD NOT BE OPEN!”
Reviews.Author: pauljack40
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, Me and my mate are two working class blokes who regulary stay in Premier Inn so I am not reviewing this from a top class hotel staying background. (Although I must say Premier Inn is really great!) Right on to the review. We actually got put in this hotel as The Gresham round the corner was overbooked. From the front it looks nice and welcoming and even on the inside foyer it is ok. However, after checking in, we were shown to a room downstairs, through a disused reception room with double beds stacked in the corner like a warehouse, past what looked like a disused dirty kitchen area and through to the back of the building. It was at this point that the women on reception left us to continue on our own way (room 4) and my alarm bells were ringing. Upon opening the door we were greeted by a smell of damp (radiator was off). We put our bags down and looked at each other and started laughing, it was so bad we couldn't do anything but! I have never in all my born days seen anything like this in my life! It was like a seedy bedsit used by call girls and the homeless. The curtain was held up badly by string that didn't draw right across - so let light in. The room itself was filthy. Thick dust on skirting boards, windows, etc. It had a small tv that was ok if you sat near it, but from the bed you needed binoculars to watch it. The worst part was the "ensuite" Jesus! It was more like a porto cabin off a campsite welded into the room than a proper ensuite. You opened the door to be met with a smell of damp - Again! Surrounded by plastic walls and floor! Also, the step into the porto cabin was covered in black dirt and mold. It was so small I could hardly sit on the toilet without getting my legs struck against the sink pedestal. There was no plug for the sink and the shower looked minging so I avoided that at all costs. Arn't you supposed to go into a bathroom to get clean clean and refreshed? Not in there! I was in and out like a shot for fear of contracting some airbourne contagious disease lol The bed heads looked like they had been fashioned from a 1970's Indian restaurant closing down sale and the bed spread was worn, old and faded - I think my nan had this cover in 1975 god rest her soul. My bottom sheet had orangey brown stains on it, I am not typing what I think it might be as I don't want to scar anyone else for life like I am. At least the mattress look fairly new - Probably one of the ones taken from the stack in the reception room? Tick there I thought lol As mentioned there was no heating as the radiator was cold and I just assumed it didn't work! As you do! Was freezing in the middle of the night, and it wasn't until the morning that I noticed the main valve had been switched off so I could have turned it! - Dam! Was annoyed with myself for that! On the plus side, me and my mate had a great night out in Soho and then clubbing, we didn't get in till 3 and we left the room by 10am so didn't stay in that long. But be warned! even though we didn't stay long, it will be etched on my memory for life! As a side thought, me and my mate discussed how much we would have paid them had we been visiting from the Chan 4 program "Four in a bed" We agreed on £20, purely for location. I said they should have paid me to stay there!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there- it's a complete rip off”
Reviews.Author: Ros B
Reviews.Content: We were prepared for something basic but this was beyond imagination for crapola. The room at £75.00 just for a double bed overnight was in a basement with 2 towels a small bar of soap - and that was it. No breakfast; a dirty shared shower with the loo in it. No lamps, only an overhead light. Paper thin walls. We were not given a front door key and assumed someone would be on reception through the night. When we arrived just back just before 11pm, it was locked with a mobile number stuck in the window. The woman who took our money was surly to the point of rudeness; her level of English was appalling. The sheets WERE clean but for £75.00 you'd expect that !!!! but don't expect anything else except someone out to rip you off. The 'Hotel' IS in a nice part of London; the building from outside is quite attractive ( as in the photo ) but the reality once you get inside the doors is far from that. It is run down, seedy and being used by someone to make a packet from unsuspecting travellers. I repeat; don't be tempted; don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: Filthy hot and horrible , we passed on the shower in the morning, it would have done more harm than good. DO NOT STAY THERE !!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: bunnywhizz
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in but I'll start by saying the staff were very understanding that we couldn't check in until later and the women on the phone seemed quite polite and helpful. However, when we arrived at the hotel I was overwhelmed with the smell of body odour - and I mean really overwhelmed. The decor was very shabby and the place just looked extremely rundown. I went to check in and the man wouldn't take my credit card but asked for cash so I said I'd have to walk to a cashpoint in the snow. He did give me a brolly which was nice. However, he didn't seem happy about letting me leave without paying and suddenly the credit card machine started working. I was so tired I forgot my PIN and he said 'well how were you going to take money out the cash machine then?' This was a valid question but it was said in an accusatory way. I explained I'd have used my debit card to which he said I could use it at the hotel. Basically the whole rundown look of the place made me nervous entering my PIN for my bank account whereas at least with a creditcard if you get cleared out it's easier to get the money back. Anyway I paid and the man opens a door leading down to a seedy looking, damp smelling basement and told us our rooms were down there. I actually felt quite scared and was worried about being kicked down there and locked in! A Japanese couple who were also checking in got quite upset and the women said she wouldn't go down so they left. Our room was horrible. The bed had massive springs poking out, there was no heating/radiator on despite it being below zero outside, it smelt of damp, the electric socket looked unsafe as it wasn't completely covered, there was one thin sheet and a stained blanket for warmth, the walls were thin and we could hear talking throughout the night. I could go on! I don't normally moan about hotels as I've stayed in basic ones in lots of different countries but this hotel was beyond basic. There was no excuse for how horrible it was and at £60 a night I'd have rather paid an extra £20 and stayed somewhere better. It's funny that the worst hotel I have ever stayed in happens to be in my own country. Needless to say my husband and I didn't sleep well at all as we were huddled for warmth and we left at 6am just to get out of there. I have photos to upload but I'm at work at the moment so am unable to. If you do want to see them you can message me and I'll be more than happy to show you or I'll try to upload them on here. I would avoid this place it's not worth the money at all.

Reviews.Title: “How is this place still open?”
Reviews.Author: Andrew F
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Lonsdale to find another customer busily filling in a complaint form, he said to us ''I'd turn around and leave if I were you'', or words to that effect, and I have to admit that he did have a point. The type of room which we had pre-booked some months previously (double room with en-suite) was unavailable due to plumbing issues, and we agreed to look at a twin room before deciding whether to stay or not. We were given the key to room 26, which was next to room 33 bizarrely enough, and made it very difficult to find. On entering the room we were struck by the sweltering heat, the lack of any bed linen and the general scruffiness of the room itself, which had a dirty carpet (like the rest of the place). While trying to find the room we were struck by the poor state of repair of the hotel in general, and the grimy feel of the place, not to mention the uneven floors and a the general lack of any Fire safety, if that place catches light it would be very difficult to get out. The lady on reception was actually fairly helpful, obviously well practiced in the art of fielding complaints/ dealing with refunds. She even offered to provide a free taxi to another Hotel which we declined as it was probably of a similar standard to the Lonsdale! I would guess that this establishment is the sort of place where asylum seekers are housed temporarily while their cases are handled. I really wouldn't wish for anyone to have to stay here for too long! I hate to say it but it really is that bad, even the receptionist knows it!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in England??”
Reviews.Author: DC1972
Reviews.Content: Disgusting. Paint flaking. Damp. No water pressure. No proper lock on the door. Lumpy bed. 3 TV channels. Just horrible. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: bmwgal2002_11
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I have ever seen. I couldn't wait to get out of the building. My friend and I had reserved a room for a 3-day stay. Once we arrived, the front desk clerk told us our room number. When we arrived at the room a maid had just heavily sprayed some "disinfectant" around the room. . . the room smelled like someone died in it, it was the most horrible smell I have ever encountered. The disinfectant spray didn't hide the smell, it only made it worse. It made both of us sick. We immediately returned to the clerk and told her we were not staying in that room. We left and went to another hotel around the corner (The Gresham) which was not much better, but at least it was clean and smelled OK.

Reviews.Title: “I won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: Onthespringboard
Reviews.Content: If this is not the last place you can find in London, pls. go for other hotels. Normally, I'm ok with simple accommodation, but not here. The room wasn't look so clean. We paid 60 Pounds but I feel like 30. The room is old and no toilet included. Moreover, I don't think the location is good!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_B71
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fairly cheap rates, conveniently located beside a nice park and underground railway station. Cons: Very poor service, rude staff, dirty & dusty, old & decrepit, no security. We arrived at check-in time (3:00 pm) and were provided with our room key. Climbed the stairs (no elevator) to the 3rd floor, used towels, used bed sheets, even buckets with cleaning products strewn throughout the corridors creating many obstacles / trip hazards / hazardous substances particularly for children. This was the same on all floors... Arrived at our room to find the door already wide open with a used towel being used as a door wedge. Suffice it to say, the room wasn't ready for us. Cracked walls, chipped paint, worn out smelly old carpet. The state of the room, and the mess in the corridors gave the impression that the cleaner(s?) had suddenly stopped what they were doing and ran off in an emergency! There was no one around at all, so had to return to reception to complain. Was fed a load of rubbish and excuses, and had to demand another room. Cancellation was not an option as we were refused a refund. Our new room was ready this time, but the general condition was the same. The whole place is very OLD and is in desperate need of refurbishment. The cleaners only make the beds with fresh sheets which are clean, and provide fresh towels which are also clean (the Lonsdale's only positive note). The cleaners do nothing more it seems, as the whole place is caked with dust and is quite drab. The showers are dirty and mouldy, a warning for allergy sufferers such as myself. Receptionists hand over the keys to ANY room, no questions asked. Went in and asked for the keys to three separate rooms at once (for family members not present) and they were quickly provided with nothing said. The front door to the street is ALWAYS kept ajar, despite a sign on the outside asking for guests to ring the bell to gain entry. The shared toilet for the non en-suite rooms on our floor was not resupplied with toilet paper and ran out. My wife advised the receptionist who had the cheek to hand a roll to her expecting HER to re-stock the toilet herself!!! My wife explained that we were actually just going out, and when we returned later that afternoon, the toilet paper had still not been replenished. Again, my wife advised the two lazy receptionists, one of whom said "Oh yes, this is the lady who wanted the toilet paper". My wife responded "No! I told you that the first floor wants more toilet paper, and YOU can take it up". Still, the receptionists tried to hand the roll over to us. Still no paper in the toilets the following morning... The images of the hotel give a false impression in my opinion. The images of the rooms look much nicer than what we saw during our stay. Not happy at all, won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The other reviews are true, there are bed bugs in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saralusini
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Lonsdale Hotel for 3 nights in June 201. The hotel didn't seem to be as bad as pictured in many other reviews at first. I have stayed in worse hotels before, meaning less clean and uglier. The room was basic and not particularly beautiful, but it seemed reasonably clean. The first thing I did was check the mattrass for signs of bedbugs, that is small blood stains, but couldn't see any. But the second night, before going to bed, I checked the bedclothes again and I could see three small blood stains...which looked very suspicious. Apart from this, they were cleaning the room everyday, and we always got clean towels. The toilet and showers were not particularly clean, but also not particularly dirty. Acceptable, I would say. The people at the reception were always very friendly. All in all, when I left I thought it was not as bad as I had expected. But 4 days after coming back home, I noticed that bites started to appear all over my left arm, and on my feet. I had never had bedbugs bites before, but I am quite sure that these are indeed bedbugs bites. I have lots of them, appearing in the shape of a line, one on the top of the other. I read on the internet that as opposed to mosquito bites, bedbugs bites always appear in a cluster. And they tend to itch much more, which is what I am experiencing now. The thing is, I really hope I didn't bring them home... All in all, I think it was a terrible mistake to go to the Lonsdale Hotel. It's cheap and central, but keep in mind that you will be sharing your room with tons of bedbugs. If I could go back in time, I would definitely book another hotel. it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “a place so bad that hookers wouldnt want to be there!”
Reviews.Author: TIAGO189158
Reviews.Content: As me and my 19 friends went into the "hotel", they said that they wanted the money upfront. since that was not the arranjements we said no. after a big arrgumente with the rude staff, they finaly gave us our keys. how i now wish they didnt. the rooms had sperm on the wall, that had holes as well, needles (drug) were found under our beds, all the keys open all the rooms, the rooms could only be looked in the outside meaning the when we were a sleep they were opend. 3.h after chekin in, we cheked out and stayed in a 5 star hotel. we rathed pay a lot for qualaty then pay 50 for not at all. the rooms were absalutly filthy and i was discused to be in those unwashed sheets. DO NOT GO TO THIS GOD FORSAKIN PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Simple,well located,clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett27
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only for one night .They charged £55 for a twin room , without breakfast, which is very cheap. The room was clean, the area is quiet and central. All what we needed! Only one bad point - walls are really thin and you can hear everything whats going on in neighbour room ))))) My neighbours was realy talkative!!! even at1am....

Reviews.Title: “Stranded me”
Reviews.Author: markoer
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, they told me there was no room for me. Eventually they tried to book the agency's credit card and for any reason the transaction failed. They didn't bother either contacting the agency or myself about that, since the period was busy they just booked someone else. As an excuse, they said there was no telephone number to contact on the fax. My Goddness, can't you just fax back to the source number you received the reservation? are people really so stupid or just pretend to be for their own interests? Anyway, I would certainly not recommend this to anyone neither I will try my luck with them again.

Reviews.Title: “The guys sleeping rough are better off...”
Reviews.Author: Steven_Bird
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest, smelliest place complete with bad service,very rude,un-polite staff. We booked in at 15:30 and were back out by 15:50 as the dust and smell had affected my rhinitis beyond belief... I actually believe that the guys sleeping on the streets were actually better off! We told the staff that we couldn't stay in such a filthy place and that we required a full refund. The receptionist told me that this wasn't possible as she didn't have a supervisor card for the machine and that I would have to write to the owners for a refund. When we asked for the contact details for the owners the receptionist said they did not have contact details for him (which I believe was a blatant lie). Now I am home and have an e-mail stating a no show! I am now dreading that I have 2 charges to dispute against this dump! I have contacted booking.com and they are trying to help me resolve the no show issue at least, my bank are taking up the refund issue...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel From Hell”
Reviews.Author: NornIronNo1
Reviews.Content: Attempted to find somewhere to stay in London for the weekend and this was the only place we could find for the number of rooms we wanted. We didn't realise at the time we were going away on the weekend of the London Marathon. Arrived at the hotel at approx 3pm. On arrival we found out that the rooms we had requested wern't available and had actually lost one of the rooms we requested. We asked could we see a room and were told we couldn't as the rooms weren't ready (even though check out is down as 10AM!) We finally agreed on rooms as we worked out we could make do without one of them. The hotel staff, who were rude and generally unhelpful (didn't even have managers contact details to give us), told us to come back half an hour later and the rooms would be ready. Asked about leaving our bags there and were told just to set them on the floor. They was no where secure to put them. On arrival back at the hotel we were informed that wehad been given another room, even though we had agreed to change this before. Therefore we ended up paying for a room we actually didn't need. One room was blocked with towels preventing people getting into it. The en-suites are tiny (look like a built in wardrobe). Window's wouldn't stay open and as the heating was on all day you were returning to an uncomfortable room. No proper blankets for the bed. Only one thin pillow per bed, you may as well be lying with your head on the mattress. Locks looked as if they had been broke. Main staircase was also the emergency exit which was blocked most of the time with towels etc. Water stains down the ceiling and walls. Key is supposed to be handed in every time you leave the hotel (we chose not to do this) and on arrival back at times there was no member of staff there that you could have got your key back from. We spent as much time as possible OUT of this hotel as we couldn't bear being in it. Wish we had of seen some reviews of it before we decided to book here. WARNING: DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES STAY IN THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever! - Absolute Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: aNITraveller12
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in quite a few hotels on my travels, this has got to be the worst one ever. We weren't expecting a five star hotel for the price but we were at least expecting the rooms we had booked! I received a phone call from the hotel around an hour and a half before we were able to check in at 1500. They were just confirming the number of rooms and type that we had booked. They never mentioned that there might be problems ahead for us. We headed for the hotel early to try and leave our baggage in before check in time. When we arrived they confirmed that we would have to wait until 1500 to check in. This was fine as that is what we expected. But then I was told that a single ensuite I had booked was no longer available so it would be a single basic (with shared bathroom facilities). This wasn't ideal but we convinced ourselves it would be okay. Then we were told that we would be in 2 family rooms, the single room, and a triple ensuite. - 4 rooms in total not the five I had booked (2 x twin ensuites, 1 single ensuite, 1 double ensuite and a triple basic) This essentially meant that people who should have had there own room would have to share with friends. After a considerable amount of arguing we worked out that the price would now be less since we didn't have all the rooms we had booked. But then we were told we would not be able to check in until after 1700 rather than 1500. That in itself was unacceptable as we had to be leaving the so called 'hotel' after 1600 to get back into town. Then the time miraculously came down to 1530 when we could check in. I also asked for a discount for the lack of an ensuite with the single room now to be told £5.00 a night is all they could throw off the price - a grand total of £10.00 of a reduction - wow very generous of them! I also asked to speak with a manager to be told he had already been that morning and probably wouldn't be back at the hotel over the weekend. On asking if they could not phone or contact them the receptionist said they did not have contact details for him (which I believe was a blatant lie). We also asked to see a room but were told we could not because they were being cleaned. We headed to a local pub to wait on check in and grab some food after being told they would phone us. No call came. We returned to the 'hotel' at approx 1550. We could now check in but the price had returned to normal as they had moved a guest to another hotel and gave us an extra room that we didn't have the people to fill! We ended up paying for a room that was empty all weekend. The young man at reception said that now we got what we wanted 5 rooms again. After thinking and accepted that we would have to share for a cheaper price this only infuriated us again. It was an absolute disgrace. Unfortunately for us we were stuck. Having flown into England only hours before and knowing hotels in the area and London generally were already fully booked we had no option but to reluctantly pay for the rooms they were giving us. It is amazing that they didn't keep the rooms we booked online free rather than having to move us to a rooms we didn't want nor book. Using an excuse that one room had been flooded. That doesn't explain us getting none of the rooms we booked. The rooms themselves were basic to say the least. Falling apart - damp on the walls, window frames rotten - a light missing it's fluorescent tube but no measures taken to make it look at all safe. Nails protruding from the wall. Basically sheets as covers for the beds. Not even a wardrobe. When they made out our receipt they had listed on it the original rooms that we had booked not the replacements they had forced upon us. It therefore seems as though we payed for the rooms we wanted which is not the case. I honestly don't think the staff cared at all about our situation. As long as they were taking our money. This place should be closed down - how it has ever managed to pass any inspection is a mystery to me. Really put our trip to London off to a bad start. Would never go back there again. Would hope no one goes through what we went through.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay! Even £50 was overpriced for this!”
Reviews.Author: nomnom22
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a collegue at this hotel for it's ideal location. As we walked down the street and saw all the hotels we were gutted ours was the worst there. In fact the worst I have ever stayed in. Unwelcoming staff spoke to us as if we were an inconvience as we walked through into the reception. She (i presume she is an exchange student on placement or something as she did not speak english well at all) just simply said 'WAIT' as I told her who we were. Another woman then abruptly told us to sign in and gave us our room key. I had no idea where this room was and when i asked she tutted and said down the hall. I've never been into this hotel before and I was expected to know this??? The room was even worse than the staff. it stunk of sewage everytime we turn the taps on. I used a tissue to touch everything. to be honest i don't know how i slept there, it was that disgusting. Paint was chipping off the walls, the sheets weren't clean. the bathroom was vile. to make matters worse, i went to reception and asked for 2 cup and she pointed into the dining room and said in the kitchen. i then had to walk to get the cup myself into the staff kitchen where i found absolutely filthy sink and food just left on the side uncovered. Needless to say we ate out. Seriously, terrible place, filthy rooms and disgusting service. I wouldn't wish my worst enemy a stay at this hotel! Do not look over this message, take my advice!! Learn from my mistake!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth £50 a room”
Reviews.Author: Lhoult85
Reviews.Content: Rooms very very basic shared toilet :-( if o could choose what to pay for this room I would have paid £10 tops

Reviews.Title: “bad service,very rude,unpolite staff”
Reviews.Author: shaniwilliam
Reviews.Content: we often stay in hotel a lot of times,before it is very clean,nice smell in the room,very friendly staff with the sweet asian smile dutyful chinese receptionist at the night time,asian face morning receptionist good as well .They wore smart uniform,good looking ,we like them, Now the hotel is very awful,the rooms has no pillow,no toillete roll,tv not working,everywhere is dusty,the indian receptionist very rude,frown,always busy with her mobile,no smile,with the unformal dress,Last monday ,we were waiting outside for 1 hour at the night time,never never stay such a hotel in the future,

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, budget hotel in great location for west end”
Reviews.Author: cherub2801
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night for a West End show trip & were more than happy with the room for the money we spent to stop there. Upon arriving we were asked if we wanted to view the room before we paid - having read some of the other reviews we thought we'd do this! We were pleasently surprised though, clean, roomy, warm - bathroom was a little on the small side but had everything you needed and was also clean. The staff were very accomodating, although the lack of tea/coffee facilities was a little annoying, it was only a 2 minute walk to a cafe to remedy this and at such cheap prices for central London we could hardly complain. We had to leave our key when we went out with the guarantee of someone being on reception when we got back - no matter how late. We did roll in quite late, a little worse for wear after a few drink in the West End, but the staff were helpful and friendly and we weren't left waiting around to get our key. On departure we weren't quite ready to leave at 10am (checkout time) but they didn't hurry us and gave us an extra 15minutes without batting an eyelid. Overall, it obviously isn't the best hotel in London, however for the money it was excellent quality, very clean and welcoming and I'd definately stop here again if I were in London for a 1 night stay...any longer though and I think I'd have to reconsider as I do like my creature comforts and tea & coffee is a must for me personally, a whole weekend without easy access to it would be slightly annoying.

Reviews.Title: “O.M.G.”
Reviews.Author: Carolanne-51
Reviews.Content: Three steep winding flights of stairs - through a warren of tiny corridors. The room looked terrible - wires hanging out of the walls, switches painted over, divans sides stained and nasty - as though left out in the rain, no hot water, missing bulbs, window didn't shut and was falling apart - and there was a very interesting bowl of confiscated razor blades at reception.The plus side - we were only there for one night - two would have been intolerable - and the sheets /towels seemed clean .If they ask if you want to see your room before you pay - say yes - I didn't!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!! FAULTY WIRING!! USED CONDOM IN ROOM!!!!”
Reviews.Author: m0rph3us
Reviews.Content: Right where do we start, to say that I am stunned this place is even allowed to open is an understatement, granted it's a budget place but that does not mean it should be positively a health hazard! We travelled with three other couples from the north of England down to London to see a friend in concert, this hotel was convenient and well priced and looked ok on the site we booked with, when we arrived we were given our keys and informed where our rooms were, after climbing a very steep staircase with lots of bags we were met with the horror of our rooms, our room (me and my partner) had the following problems a) Flourescent bulb missing from lamp above bed (no diffuser and exposed terminals) b) Collapsed mains socket internal condition unknown as it was held together with two different screws c) 2 inch thick pillows (only 2 of) d) Room charged as a double but was in fact two single beds pushed together e) Rotten window frame (couldn't fully open window) f) Screws protruding through wooden makeshift cupboard After talking with our friends we discovered one of their rooms had the following problems. a) Window could not be held open b) Exposed wiring c) Sharp object protruding from the wall at head height right next to the bed d) A used condom left in the room The third room we were booked in had the following problem. a) BED BUGS!!!! Our friends didn't spot the bed bugs till they were actually in bed at about 3 in the morning and they ended up leaving the room and staying in with our other friends, up until this point the hotel (if you can call it that) offered us the insulting refund of £15 on two £70 rooms, yes that was £15 for the faults listed above, we have now been offered a full refund for the bed bug infested room but will be seeking compensation I'm quite surprised that whoever is supposed to check these places hasn't closed this one down as it is certainly a health hazard and should be closed immediately.

Reviews.Title: “-1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: laura198935
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in the hope that the reviews would be wrong. We went with an open mind knowing it would be basic. But it was worse than we could have ever imagined. Not even worth having as a base (which is what we needed it for) as it was so terrible. The room was falling to bits the lock was hanging off leaving our stuff so unsafe. It had an awful fusty smell, the quilt wasnt even a quilt it was just a sheet. There was no hair dryer no kettle and the tv was like watching fuzz! Also the bed was a 3/4 and the mattress was a double so it just hung off/ Even if you want something basic just to sleep in spend a bit more and stay in a normal hotel. Oh and in 3 days they didnt even empty the bin.

Reviews.Title: “this is a hostel not a hotel avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: cav0
Reviews.Content: we arrived at this hostel described on all sites as a hotel but it isnt, you have to share toilet and bathroom even though it doesnt state anywhhere on the sites advertising this when you book. we came to check in and to our dismay they had given our twin room to someone else and the only rooms available were two single rooms locked away in the basement (these looked like staff quarters) i wouldnt leave a dog in there!! we refused these rooms and asked for the manager but he wasnt available and no ther help or rooms were offered even though four people came in after us having booked the same rooms as us and they got given theirs. i booked this hostel on 10th Aug this year !! so what was supposed to be a lovely night out after shopping turned to a trip home same evening on the train as no other hotels were available. do not book this hostel !! i cant even rate this place

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Think About It”
Reviews.Author: R680
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Priceline, should have known better as it was half price of other hotels in the area. We arrived late on a rainy night, on foot, dragging large bags. From the outside, it looks OK. Inside a different matter. This place needed renovation in the 80's.....the 1880's. Old in everyway, except no charm. Narrow stairways, rabbit hutch rooms, the oldest furnishings you've ever seen. Worst of all, I think, is the complete lack of fire escape routes. It was extremely difficult to find my way back to the office after looking at a room. After seeing the intended room, we took our chances back out in the rain. I was persuaded to try it due to the other review where someone saidf he had paid more for less. I don't know how this could be possible. Do Not Even Think About It.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, and ok”
Reviews.Author: SussexBigbear
Reviews.Content: They charged £40 for a single in August in Bloomsbury, without breakfast, which is very cheap. The room was clean, the area is quiet and central, most things worked. I've stayed in far worse in the area and paid far more.

Reviews.Title: “Doss House”
Reviews.Author: mitch71
Reviews.Content: This place can not be called a hotel!!!!! It is nothing more than a cess pit!!!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE BOOK SOMEWHERE ELSE ____________________________________________________________ Horrible horrible place that I had the displeasure of staying and had not been paid for us I would have demanded my money back and found somewhere else. The rooms are an absolute disgrace, absolutely minging with walls that havn't been painted since the place was built, cracks, damp patches and curtains hung that dont fit the windows I could go on and on, I wouldn't let my worst enemy stay here SO BEWARE........ BOOK AT YOUR OWN RISK...... YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED THIS IS NOT A HOTEL IT IS A CESSPIT

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Mitch1970
Reviews.Content: Seriously, where do I start? We travelled down as part of a football crowd and believe me, we're not normally fussy about where we stay, however this place is a complete hovel! The hotel is a flea infested, disgusting, pathetic, death trap and fire hazard! Between us we had three rooms booked, No's 20, 23, & 27, and myself and my wife were booked into room 27 (she's a big football fan too). Our room wasn't ready when we arrived so we left our bags in our mates room, and were amazed by it. The sink was almost hanging off the wall, you could literally move it in and out with a small shove, there was a socket that was hanging off the wall, but when you flicked the switch the light actually worked, imagine a young child in there who could quite easily get his/her fingers inside the live socket!!! When we came back late at night after the football we finally got to see our double room, and jesus I wish we hadn't bothered! The walls were dirty, the curtains didn't even cover the window and I had to cut the string at the top of them to allow them to loosen ouot to cover the whole window, the carpet was stinking, the room itself was stinking with a musty smell, and of the two shower rooms upstairs, one shower didn't work properly because the shower head wouldn't sit in the holder properly, and my wife locked herself in the other one because when you lock the door from the inside it is very stiff to close as it doesn't fit the door frame properly, and there's no handle on the inside to pull it open to get out!!! The whole hotel was just disgusting and I'm so pleased they don't do breakfast as I'd rather eat off the pavement outside than sit at one of their dinner tables! I'm not kidding when I say this, but this place should be condemned and shut down, it really is THAT bad! Also, I have no idea where they got their pics that try to promote their hotel, but they certainly didn't come from the same hotel that we stayed in! Avoid it like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP!!!”
Reviews.Author: Larsbadboy3
Reviews.Content: Where to beging the horro of this hotel. The water taste bad, the windows is 1,80 Meters times 2. And you have to lift them from the floor and up. The toilet and baths where cold as ice. The room hot as a sauna, with no way to control the heat yourself. The hotel is creap, but you will regret coming here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, inexpensive but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Titchymichy
Reviews.Content: Lonsdale Hotel, Bedford Place, London Myself and a friend stayed in a twin room with private bathroom (Room 4) for 2 nights in early May. We paid £78.18 (between us) for each of the 2 nights we stayed, which was a very good price for the location. We were located in room 4 on the ground floor. The twin room itself although clean was very dated small and smelled a little "fusty". The private bathroom it is more of a converted cupboard which housed a toilet, sink and shower tray with curtain. The ceramics & fitments, although clean and working exhibited lots of wear and tear and the whole hotel looked a little tired and neglected. We had to ask for toilet roll as there was none in the room, and some was left in reception for us (not sure why they couldn't put it in our room for us). The room had 2 single beds, a desk (but no chair), a small portable TV (no remote), and a wardrobe with shelf and hanging space (although only 1 hanger). There were spare blankets in the wardrobe (which was great as the room was very cold when we arrived). There was a radiator which did get warm but it didn't pump out much heat after we turned it on. The lighting in the room was very poor. Fresh bath towels, hand towel and soap were provided each day (which is just as well as there was no where really to hang anything damp..) . There was a toilet right outside our room which proved quite handy when both my and my friend needed to use the facilities at the same time. There was only member of reception staff on shift at a time and they were polite and attentive, although not always able to man the reception (I'm guessing due to other duties/rest breaks) so we had to hang round for a few minutes one night until they returned to their station before we could get our room key. They do have left luggage (free) which is very handy and much cheaper option than leaving it at Kings X left luggage (£8 per item per day) Check in is advertised as 15:00, we arrived early with the intention of leaving our luggage but as our room was ready we were able to check in early. check out is advertised as 11:00, We checked out at 10 and left our luggage and were able to collect it much later at about 17:30. Hotel was mainly chosen for the location & proximity to attractions (10 minute walk from Euston/St Pancreas/Kings X) very close to Russell Sq underground, on the doorstep of the British Museum, 5 minutes from Oxford street/Dominion theatre/Soho). The Original Bus Tours stop on Bedford place and the Big Bus Company stops around the corner. The Hotel is fine if you want an inexpensive hotel stay and will not be spending much time in the hotel itself. Can't fault the location, and if I was staying for 1 or 2 nights and wanted somewhere cheap I might consider another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bug infested”
Reviews.Author: billybrag
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel last summer with Spouse and woke up in the middle of the night to find insects on the pillow and down the skirting-board beside my bed. Spent the rest of the night sleeping on the floor and had to cut my holiday short b/c they were all over thr floor. The hotel mangement were aware of this and still let us book in with no prior warning of the beetles. I'm guessing the issue is now fixed - but take my advice and dont stay here

Reviews.Title: “24 hours of reception?????”
Reviews.Author: earlywalking
Reviews.Content: When i booked i`m happy because the recpetion is open 24 hours, but my first morning when i`m going out the recption is close and the notice in door: "PLS LEAVE THE KEY UNDER THE DOOR" So i`m leaving my stuff to anyone? the main door is openned i decided to take the key with my and in the evenning when i come back the receptionist is complainning because must be the key need to be in reception. I explainned what happened in the morning and the chinese ladie just say need to take a shower because is a hard worker with lot of hours. The next morning the same, and i need to make a booking for a next week: just leave the keys under the door and dont come any more. Location is good for the price the room is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “In a word: untrustworthy”
Reviews.Author: frog72
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Lonsdale in October 2009 and once we got there in January our room wasn't available. After a long discussion with the personnel (hardly speaking English) we have been relocated to another "hotel" belonging to the same owner, The Berkeley Court Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible”
Reviews.Author: flossiecozzies
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much but this place is like a doss house. The walls are staiined and full of holes, the carpet was very badly stained and the 'en-suite' was like a wet room in a cupboard. You could hardly get to the loo without banging into the washbasin. The radiator didn't work and a tiny fan heater had been provided, which didn't give out much heat. The handles on the wardrobe had come off and all the furniture was battered. The room smelled like there a was a sewer running through it and when we complained we were allocated another room. The girl on reception was not particularly welcoming but did look a bit shame-faced, as if she was used to complaints. The second room was tiny but at least it was warm. Decor and furniture were in a similar state to the first room but the en-suite was slightly better. However we had to be careful coming down the step as there was a sharp metal edge which came off if you touched it. It cost us £70 without breakfast. I would never stay here again - only stayed here because we had to get somewhere last minute and all the other places we tried were booked up.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: heredades
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel. It's place that rents dirty, unsafe rooms from a receptionist with a diploma in rude. There are other comptetively priced and good hotels with a few hundred yards. Avoid the Lonsdale at all cost!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good clean”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireTrippy
Reviews.Content: 1st impression of the room was the wardrobe doors hanging off & the mis-matched furniture....The room needed a huge clean. The net curtains looked like they hadnt been washed in about 5 years & the room was FULL of cob webs that had gathered plenty of dust too. The room itself was a good size but poorly decorated. The bathroom 'pod' was very compact but clean. The bed sheets were also clean but in poor condition. The main light in the bedroom had no light shade & you could see that the bulb had melted the bulb holder at some point...this light fused when we tried to turn it on & one of the lights above the bed was also not working, this left us one small wall light to illuminate the room. On the plus side the hotel is in a fantastic location & on a very quiet street. With a massive clean this hotel could be an affordable & pleasant place to stay...however until it has been cleaned I wont be stopping there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, great location, great place to 'bed down'.”
Reviews.Author: Ebor337
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Lonsdale on April 25th '09. I was best man for a friend and we were celebrating his stag night so I had booked 5 rooms. I was a bit dubious about booking the Lonsdale due to the 1* reviews, but I decided to go for it as a) it was extremely cheap and b) it boasts a fantastic location. I am very glad I did book it. It is indeed in a superb location, just 3 minutes from Holborn tube and next to Russell Square in a nice street alongside some 'posh' hotels. I saw all 5 rooms we booked and all were of a reasonable standard. When I say reasonable, I mean reasonable when you are paying £60 for a room in central London Location. So, they had no nice pictures on the slightly dirty walls, the carpets weren't spotless, the paintwork could have done with a good retouch and the furniture was more suited to the 80's BUT when you are spending only an hour or so awake in the rooms per day they were great. I was also impressed with the customer service. I emailed the hotel asking about early check-in/bag storage. I recieved a phone call the next day from a nice lady telling me that she was unable to email me back but it would be fine to leave our bags in the hotel. I have had worse service from 4*+ hotels. So, I think if you're realistic and don't expect too much from a budget hotel, want just somewhere to sleep for the night you'll be more than happy with the Lonsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Makes Fawlty Towers look like a nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: happydude76
Reviews.Content: Some things never change! The Lonsdale makes Fawlty Towers look like a nice place to stay! My elderly mother and I stayed in this dump back in September 1984. We had what was supposed to be the “best room” in the hotel, it was in back of the kitchen with no view out the window, noisy in the morning (when one was trying to sleep) and had only a “[-]-in” sink (the toilet was down the hall and the bathtub was upstairs). Can you believe this place came with the recommendation of a travel agent! The breakfast was highly greasy and a “heart attack on a plate”, the staff proved to be arrogant and mostly unfriendly. I left my Michelin London Guide book on the bed in my room and when I returned in the evening it went “missing”, when I told the manager he made it clear he didn’t give a [-] (he was a Monty Python stereotype of the Upper Class Twit of the Year). Moreover, on our last night I returned independent of my mother around 11:00pm and rang the front door bell for the desk clerk to let me in for almost 15 minutes, finally another guest let me in (24 hour front desk is a crock). The Canadian snot that was the desk clerk then came out to demand to know what I was doing in this hotel. When I told her, I was staying there and “thank you” for coming to let me in. She told me I should have asked for another key on check-in, thanks for telling me on my last night [-]! Folks, pay a little more money and stay in a better place for what may well be an once-in-a-lifetime trip to London, this place proved depressing.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and clean and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: martineGeneva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lonsdale Hotel with my relatives in May 2006; perfect location, good price (£70 pounds for 3 in 2 rooms), nice staff and great breakfast. Coming again to London for a week-end I naturally booked myself into this place (£30 single - no bath). Had a pleasant stay; I noticed, however, that breakfast was no longer served and that the owners looked depressed : is it due to all the bad reviews I discovered in a shock... ? Although modest, the place is very clean; I would definitely call again and passed the address on to some friends. martine - geneva

Reviews.Title: “The Lonsdale... actually a really nice place”
Reviews.Author: authenticCtraveller
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively - something like 55+ countries, and I always travel on a budget, to maximise my funds and to experience each country more 'authentically'. That being said, I shop with my eyes open, and was not expecting luxury at the Lonsdale; it was after all the absolute cheapest hotel accomodation available in London at that time. I found the hotel on-line, and booked directly with the hotel (they did not take internet bookings at that time). The room was clean, bright, not too small, the breakfast was ample, and the desk staff were most helpful. We arrived early, and they actually let us use another room to get cleaned up and changed so that we could go out and about while we waited for our room to be made up. Like in a traditional B&B, there was no lift, and we did not have a toilet in our room, but then again, being realistic about what we were paying for a room in the high season in the centre of London, we did not expect these. The staff helped us with information about the neighbourhood and local transportation. Located near the British Museum, the area was lively and safe, walking distance to almost everything, and very well connected to several tube lines. All in all, I really enjoyed my stay. The money we saved, we spent on great seats for West End shows and shopping. For people who expect a large hotel chain type of experience, this is NOT for you. If you want a nice budget stay in a safe, clean and friendly hotel, try the Lonsdale. I have recommended this hotel to fellow travels with realistic expectations, and they too have enjoyed their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and dirty”
Reviews.Author: She_8
Reviews.Content: Small rooms equipped in the old, ruined furniture look as never been cleaned up. Windows that cannot be neither opened nor closed. Bad air everywhere. Toilets are the worst - dirty and ruined as well. Service below expectations - long queues for breakfast. If you need a cup or plate you should ask - nobody from the hotel notices it. Food so bad as you immediately dream to be on diet. The only advantage of Lonsdale is location - close to British Museum, in the heart of London. But if you prefer to stay in nice, clean hotel better choose the other one. 4 other hotels are located on the same street as Lonsdale

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible, horrible”
Reviews.Author: m-travelstheworld
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever seen. My two friends from Italy booked in here for 3 nights. After the first night when they had dirty sheets, found cigarette butts in the drawers and no curtains on the windows I came over to rescue them. The floors were filthy, the stairs filled with dust, the furniture broken and the breakfast only offered between 8am and 9.30am (though I imagine you would be taking your life in your hands to eat it!) The receptionists were completely unhelpful and only gave a partial refund under extreme duress. I will be calling Trading Standards and Camden Council to report this hotel. It is horrendous and I wouldn't house my dog in it. Beware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don´t go to this... hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Mariacasa
Reviews.Content: Dirty, old, abandoned hotel. Small room, dirty walls, no light in the WC of the corridor... The fotos they show in the webs are simply false. The breakfast is very bad: no hot milk, even if you ask for it (they answered me: only cold milk!!) Please, if you don´t want to stay at a dirty hole, please don´t go.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: Necrothesp
Reviews.Content: First of all, the Lonsdale has a good location, in a nice part of London and close to the centre. We stayed for one night after coming down from the Midlands to see a musical in the West End and it was very convenient for that. That, however, is one of the few good things you can say about it. The staff was generally surly and uncommunicative and entirely foreign - some spoke very poor English. The first room we were given had no headboards on the bed and stank of stale cigarette smoke - despite our requesting a non-smoking room. The second room was very hot (radiators on full and no way of turning them down) and the light in the bathroom didn't work. We were assured that this would be fixed, and in all fairness both were fixed quickly. However, although the radiators were off the room remained very warm; it was not a cold night and we had to have the window wide open all night, which made it rather noisy. The furniture and fittings were barely adequate - many items were cracked, old and poorly maintained. The carpets were shabby and frayed. The 'ensuite bathroom' was a cabinet installed in one corner of the room and while clean enough was very cramped; there was hot water, as long as you worked out that the shower had to be turned towards the cold end to get hot! The room wasn't too dirty, but could certainly have been better. The television worked, but wasn't tuned into any stations. Breakfast was adequate (bacon, sausages, fried eggs, toast, orange juice, tea), but kept running out and had to be replenished (slowly) by very surly kitchen staff. There was only one flavour of jam and no sauces at all. All in all, not a particularly pleasant experience and I'm glad we only stayed one night - I certainly wouldn't have stayed any more. £75 per night may be cheap for London, but it is still not exactly cheap and I expect much more for my money. I have stayed in many (much, much cheaper) hostels in major European cities, and I have to say that this 'hotel' was far worse than any of them. Not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: mia1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 60pounds/night. We booked a double room, but the room had a double and a single, so the room was completely filled up! The room was shabby, and the bathroom was very small. And the water temperature was not stable at all. Yes, 60pounds for a double room is kind of cheap if I consider it is London, but still, it does not worth paying. Look for other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “could be better?”
Reviews.Author: bigbri69
Reviews.Content: Was booked at gresham hotel but because of problems moved to lonsdale hotel, not very impressed with it.Some good points, warm rooms, friendly'ish staff and plenty of hot water and not a bad breakfast. Bad points, in need of a good clean, sink was badly cracked and no plug ,shower was very dirty so would'nt use it and no tea, coffee or kettle as they advertise on their website I suppose at the end of the day you get what you pay for but would not recomend it to anyone i'm afraid which is a shame because it's location is'nt bad.

Reviews.Title: “Doss House”
Reviews.Author: jonesey27
Reviews.Content: Absolute nightmare. A Doss House and a real dive. Had a cracked sink in my room, if you would have run your fingers across it you'd have sliced your fingers off. Despite paying for two weeks accommodation, I went home for the weekend to return on the Sunday to find my room had been let out for the Saturday night. Everything I'd left in the room ended up in a plastic bag in reception and the laptop I'd hidden away in the wardrobe was gone. Hotel manager turns up for one hour every day (apparently) but you can never get hold of her. Even the police had trouble getting in touch with her. Stay clear.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad after all...”
Reviews.Author: potos
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about the hotel after reading the reviews. BUT it’s not so bad…Yes it’s like a hostel…so what? We got a twin room for £150 for three nights (during a bank holiday weekend). It’s good value considering the location. Far more cheaper than everything else in a central location. The room had all the basics and it was clean. It looked like there was a bit of refurbishment going on around the hotel , so hopefully they will improve the rooms in the near future… Do not book this hotel if you’re looking for a posh place to impress your girlfriend… Book this hotel if you just want a place to crash and if you plan to budget on the accommodation, considering everything else is expensive in London (eg. restaurants, museums, clubs…).

Reviews.Title: “Quirky-chic Lonsdale”
Reviews.Author: Andythetrav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is another shabby, but decent, foreign-run "youth hotel" in London. The staff is very casual, standoffish, and could be considered a bit rude by some. The breakfast is scant, but it's there. The price is average, and the value is decent for the location. 40 pounds a night for a single, that's without any deals or booking ahead. The room itself is kind of cute. There are neon rods that illuminate the corners of the room well. The bed is big enough, the TV and fan are junky, but they work sort of. The bathrooms are not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night at the beginning of June. We were in London for a friend's birthday and knowing how expensive London clubs/bars/restaurants are we budgeted on the hotel. The Lonsdale is the cheapest for miles around and has a great location, just near the gorgeous Russel Square, a stone's throw from Euston, Leicester square, Covent Garden and Oxford Street. The staff were neither polite nor rude, they were just quiet. The room was clean and basic, and at £75 for a triple very reasonable. The bathroom was a big disappoinment, more like an aeroplane toilet with a shower added on, and about the size of most people's bath mats. However everything worked, it was clean and reasonably comfortable and cheap. Not recommended if you're trying to impress anyone, but great for students on a budget who want a night out and great shopping more than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and Mother during the London Marathon in April. I'm generally not too fussy as long as the place is generally clean and well run. Unfortunately the Lonsdale hotel is neither of these things and I couldn’t really recommend it to anyone other than on the grounds that it is relatively cheap and has a good location to Oxford street etc. The carpets are old and frayed, the furniture shoddy, one member of staff serving breakfast and constantly running out of things. It also took a member of staff 10 minutes to open the door of our room because the lock was old. I would have moved to another hotel if we were planning a longer stay and definitely won't be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “oh my god”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this has to be the worst hotel i have ever been to, to say it was smelly and dirty is an understatement! we were booked in for three nights but after one very sleepless night had to leave even though our business check had already cleared, it looks to me as a hostel would look. DO NOT under any circumstances stay here !!!

Reviews.Title: “oh my lordie”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If y ou don't mind sharing a bathroom or having your own portapotty in your room, well then lonsdale is the place for you. the constant urine smell and dirty towels are an added bonus. the staff is fantastic, charging for phone calls that are local and should be included. but whats even better was the struggle to make a phone call. you have to ask them to use the line which isn't easy because half the time you can't even communicate with them. i think the bed gave me a rash and oh my those rooms aren't spacious at all. every night it sounded like there was a herd of elephants coming down the stairs... whata dump overall... i hated it. i expected at LEAST clean towels. if your staying here... bring your own towels.

Reviews.Title: “Expect a basic Bed & Breakfast and you will have no surprises. ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a Hotel stay away. Well, what can I say...a weekend in London planned and we booked in here for two nights. Arrived late on Friday evening to find out that out double en-suite room was in fact a double room, with a shower cubicle within the room and a shared toilet along the corridor. The carpet was terrible - looked like it had been scrateched by a cat, the furniture was very basic and very shabby. The bedspread was threadbare, the decor in desperate need, oh and one towel between two of us. In normal circumstances I would have asked for an additional towel and asked about their understanding of the word 'ensuite', but the shock and horror of seeing the room just overcame us. Things were so bad, we were nervous about taking our shoes off....the only thing we could think was that we wouldn't be staying the two nights that we had paid for....but we were just too tired to do anything about it there and then. On the positive side, the bed linen was very clean and the bed very comfortable, but the moment we woke, we washed and went on the serach of new accomodation....at any price! We skipped breakfast at the 'hotel' and ate in a lovely cafe in Russell Square. After asking around at a few hotels, everywhere seemed fully booked, but one hotel booked us in at a hotel in the City (not really where we wanted to be, but anywhere, anywhere was better than another night at the Lonsdate!!), back to the Lonsdale, collected our bags and ran to the nearest tube station. We felt like two school children running away!!! It was so dire that we didn't even stop to ask for our money back for the second night, the relief of knowing we could stay somewhere else was so enormous!! Once across town, we checked into a fab hotel and immediately showered and changed....Saturday morning all but over, but the rest of the weekend was excellent, however, without a sense of humour and the cash to book somewhere else, it could have been a right disaster! My advice - if you're looking for a Bed and Breakfast that you are willing to pay over the top for, then this is the place, but don't believe what you see when you look at the booking options....I am sure with a lick of paint and some decent furniture this could be an OK place, but if its a cheap hotel you're after you'll get far better value for money at a Travelodge or Travel Inn and at least you know what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “B Y F A R T H E W O R S T H O T E L I ' V E E V E R B E E N I N”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd found this web site and read these reviews BEFORE I stopped in this sorry excuse for a Hotel. But even I had, I probably wouldn't have believed it could be as bad as other reviewers have said. Having stayed there, I now realise they were being kind: 1) The foyer is a bit scruffy. 2) The person who checked us in smelt of . 3) Having already got suspicous, I asked to see the room before I checked in and paid. Unfortunately, I didn't stand my ground, figuring I could always get my money back if it was to awful. DO NOT DO THIS - THEY WILL NOT GIVE A REFUND. 4) As we walked up to the room up the filthy, and I mean FILTHY, carpets the smell of damp increased our foreboding. Mess lay around, cupboard doors standing open etc. Surely the room must be an improvement, we prayed... 5) We were in London for a Valentines weekend, but were given a twin room, having booked a double. First night ruined as they couldn't move us until the next day. 6) Carpet unbelievably dirty. 7) Hot water didn't work propelry. 8) TV remote had no batteries in. 9) Light was broken. 10) Blankets were clean but of really crap quality. 11) Toilet seat was broken off. 12) Furniture looked like it was from a jumble sale, mismatched, cheap and ancient. 13) I refused to eat the breakfast - if a hotel cares this little for the cleanliness of its rooms, what is the kitchen and food going to be like... 14) Asked for my money back the next morning, they refused, I left anyway. I am now in a quite brilliant hotel called the Crestfield up near Kings Cross - friendly staff, clean rooms, bar AND, TO SHUT THE "WHAT DO YOU EXPECT FOR £X" SQUAD UP, THE CRESTFIELD IS CHEAPER!! There are may hotels in London as cheap of this, NONE are as bad as this one. Just don't do it, is all I can add.

Reviews.Title: “Think again”
Reviews.Author: Tegid-France
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worthy of the 3* rating. We changed rooms three times before finding something acceptable. If we hadn't been working in the area we would have checked out on day one. The reception consisted of 'fill in this form and give me your card details' not even hello! The first room had wall paper peeling off the walls - the second room had a gale force draught through the window and no central heating (the radiator was falling off the wall!) Finally we took a room with cupboard doors falling off - cracked sink and a very unsafe electrical socket. The hotel is in a good location - in my opinion pay a bit more and avoid a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “tricksters”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: These people took our money and then bluntly told us we had been moved to its sister hotel, no apology just an order!. The hotel we were moved to was the GRESHAM. Purfect location for Oxford Street, theatres etc if you dont mind living like a rat for the night. Best only stayed at if youre desperate for a room. I think I'll be paying a bit more in future.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in the World?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot stress quite how awful this place is. If you look you will see that there are many bad reviews about this place. I urge you to read all of these before you make a decision to book a room at the Lonsdale. Colleagues of mine stayed here and listed a catalogue of reasons not to stay: fleas in the beds, decrepid furniture, porta-loo-toilets!, ridiculously poor breakfast, strange smells in the rooms, etc. Furthermore, they were concerned about the other "guests", who appeared to be treating the place as a doss-house. All in all, this did not add up to a pleasant experience and they only managed a couple of hours sleep. NOT what you want for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: never have we stayed anywhere like this. I don't know how it has the nerve to call itself a hotel. Dirty, and could someone please tell me where the lounge is to relax and meet up with friends?? I understand that you don't expect the Ritz for £45 per night, but cleanliness and friendly staff must count for something. No breakfast the next morning because the "dining room" was too small to seat everyone and the food was cooked just on an ordinary cooker ie one egg at a time, and the place was full. It is obvious that the owners of this just want to make a profit out of people and are not concerned about their well being.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK! What do you expect for £40?!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only came across these reviews after booking the hotel online, and reading these reviews made me want to cancel. But - it was too late, and now I am staying there, I am glad I didn't cancel! The staff are really friendly and helpful, and it isn't the cesspit people are making it out to be. It's what you'd expect for £40 in Central London. A decent sized comfy bed, a kettle, a television, ample storage space. I didn't go for an ensuite, I went for a basic, which still has a sink in the room so you can freshen up if you want to - the shared showers and toilet are clean, and there's plenty of others to use if one is busy. A buffet breakfast is included, you can choose from basic items in an English breakfast - sausage, bacon, eggs, tomato with toast - or there's cornflakes and fruit available. Breakfast is served with tea, coffee or orange juice. The room is QUIET, which is a real blessing, and there's a heater which means you control the temperature of the room. True, the windows don't have locks on, but all rooms are on the first floor and upward, and they're the old fashioned 'lift up' windows which are nigh-on-impossible to get into from the outside and the doors have inside deadlocks. True, the decor isn't amazing, but what did you expect? The Malmaison? If you haven't booked already - don't be put off by the reviews, and maybe take a wander down Bedford Street before deciding where to stay. There are 7 or 8 other B&Bs down the same road and one of them is bound to have vacancies. If you like to have things firmed up in advance, then book into here for one night, then check out the other hotels once you get here. Don't expect the world; if you want something nicer, go and pay more money. If you just want a place to lay your head down at night, or do some reading and writing in the evening, you may just have found your base.
